snippet: Louis J. Freeh, the trustee overseeing the bankruptcy of MF Global, estimates that creditors, including banks, big investors and service providers, could have more than $3 billion in claims against the failed brokerage.
abstract: Louis J. Freeh, the trustee overseeing the bankruptcy of MF Global, estimates that creditors, including banks, big investors and service providers, could have more than $3 billion in claims against the failed brokerage.

headline.main: MF Global Trustee Says Claims May Exceed $3 Billion
